data.QueryText: Asked about doses of fertilizer for coconut
data.KccAns: Recommended to apply Organic manure @ 25 kg/plant  every year. Open the coconut basin and apply Lime @ 1 kg has to be applied in acid soils two weeks before of fertilizer application.The first split has to be applied in April-June. The dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj  phos, 1  kg Potash per palm respectively. The second dose has to apply in September-October and the dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj phos, 1kg Potash per palm respectively.

data.KccAns: Suggested to spray Chlorantraniliprole 18.5 SC 3ml in 10 litres of water for management of pod bug in peas

data.QueryText: Asked about white pipe in banana
data.KccAns: Responded for banana white pipe symptom, to apply lime at 1 kilogram per banana and after 2 weeks add Borax 10 gram per plant in the soil or spray 2 gram mixed in 1 litre of water.

data.QueryText: Asked about management of banana pseudostem weevil
data.KccAns: Responded for management of banana pseudostem weevil, to cut 60 cm long pseudostem of harvested banana plant and cut it longitudinally and keep it in the centre of field covered in the evening. Kill the weevils by hand in the morning.

data.QueryText: Asked about management of pseudostem weevil in banana
data.KccAns:
Recommended to regularly remove dried hanging leaves of the plant. Place 50 gram neem cake powder in the leaf axils on the 5th, 6th and 7th months. 
Mix 3 ml neem oil in 1 litre mud slurry and swab around the pseudostem.
Set traps using pseudostem approximatetly 0.5 m length, split lengthwise and lay in the field. Collect weevils from trap and destroy it.
Spray Beauveria bassiana or Metarhizium anisopliae @ 20g per litre water on pseudostem and pseudostem traps. Fill the leaf axil with Beauveria bassiana or Metarhizium anisopliae @ 20g per litre water. 
Spray Chlorpyrifos 20 EC @ 1.5 ml per litre of water with nozzle directed to the leaf axils and bore holes.

data.QueryText: Nutrient management in Acid lime sixth year and above
data.KccAns: 30 Kg Organic manure ,1300g Urea , Rajphos 1Kg and Potash 498 g per plant per year,  apply fertilizers in two equal splits, once during May June and second during September - October. Two weeks prior to fertilizer application during May – June apply 500 g lime per plant.

data.QueryText: Asked about management of Rhinoceros Beetle
data.KccAns:
Recommended to provide field sanitation to prevent breeding of beetles. Hook out the beetle from the attacked palms using beetle hook. As a prophylactic measure, application of 250 gram neem cake or marotti (Hydnocarpus wightina) cake mixed with equal volume of sand in the innermost 2-3 leaf axils. This treatment is to be done twice, ie, during April-May before the onset of south-west monsoon and during September-October after the south-west monsoon. Naphthalene balls 12.0 gram (approx. 4 nos.) can be put in the innermost 2 leaf axils adjacent to spindle leaf and covered with fine sand, once in 45 days.  Crown cleaning followed by the application of 20 gram Ferterra 0.4 G mixed with 200 gram sand in the innermost 2-3 leaf axils. The application has to be done thrice during January, May and September.
Spray Metarrhizium anisopliae (250 ml Metarrizhium culture + 750 ml water) in manure pits and other breeding sites of the beetle or incorporate  Clerodendron infortunatum @ 10 % w/w basis in the cowdung and manure pits.

data.QueryText: Asked about Pseudomonas Application in banana
data.KccAns: Suggested to do sucker treatment with Pseudomonas fluorescens @ 20 gram per litre of water + soil drenching of  Pseudomonas fluorescens @ 20 gram per litre of water.

data.QueryText: Asked about management of red palm weevil in coconut
data.KccAns:
Recommended to practice clean cultivation by cutting and removing palms already damaged and the decaying stumps in the garden. Avoid making steps or any other injury on the tree trunks to reduce the loci of infestation.
As a prophylactic measure, clean the crown and apply 250 gram neem cake mixed with equal volume of sand in the innermost 2-3 leaf axils. Naphthalene balls 12.0 gram (approx. 4 nos.) in the innermost 2 leaf axils and covered with fine sand, once in 45 days.
Observe for boreholes in attacked palms and seal all except the top most one. Through the top most hole, imidachloprid (1ml/ litre of water) @ 1-2 litre per palm, using a funnel.

data.QueryText: Asked about management of pseudostem weevil in banana
data.KccAns:
Recommended to remove severly affected plants. Regularly remove dried hanging leaves of the plant. Observe strict field sanitation. Uproot severly affected plants and burn or destroy using kerosene. Place 50 gram neem cake powder or bar soap in the leaf axils on the 5th and 7th month.
Cut pseudo stem into small pieces in lengths of up to 60 cm and split each along its length. The split pseudo stem are placed in the soil in the way that the cut portion faces the ground. The recommended number is 30 to 40 numbers (split traps) per acre.
The open cut side of the above pseudostem trap can be sprayed with solution of Beauveria bassiana  (5 gram /liter). The weevil gets infected by the fungal spores when it enters the pseudostem trap. This kills the insects within 72 hours.
n case of severe attack, spray or Quinalphos 25 EC (1.5 ml/litre of water) with nozzle directed to the leaf axils and bore holes.

enrol PMFBY through CSC or Akshaya centre via. https://pmfby.gov.in/. Documents required are aadhar card, phone number, bank pass book, land right document, land possession certificate, sowing certificate or self declaration of intent to sow the proposed crop.

data.QueryText: Asked about Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
data.KccAns:
Suggested that Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) scheme provide insurance coverage and financial support to the farmers in the event of failure of any of the notified crop as a result of natural calamities, pests and diseases.
Apply online through  CSC or Akshaya centre.
Essential documents required are 
1. Land Rights Documents- Record of Right (RoR) 
2. Land Possession Certificate (LPC)
3. Aadhar Card (updated)
4. Bank Passbook (First Page –having details of bank accounts)
The scheme implimented in two seasons - Kharif and Rabi. The last date for registering PMFBY in Kharif season was 1st August 2022. Registration for rabi season will start on October 2022.

data.QueryText: Asked about fertilizer requirement in Nutmeg Third year
data.KccAns: Lime or dolomite has to be applied in acid soils two weeks ahead of fertilizer application. Organic manure @ 20 kg/plant is recommended in every year. The first split has to be applied in May-June. The urea, rock phosphate, Muriate of Potash needed at this time is 66 gram, 150 gram, 126 gram respectively per plant. The second dose has to apply in September-October and the dosage is 63 gram urea, 150 gram rock phosphate, 82 gram Muriate of Potash respectively per plant.

data.QueryText: Asked about fertilizer requirement in Nutmeg fifth year
data.KccAns: Lime or dolomite has to be applied in acid soils two weeks ahead of fertilizer application. Organic manure @ 30 kg/plant is recommended in every year. The first split has to be applied in May-June. The urea, rock phosphate, Muriate of Potash needed at this time is 110 gram, 250 gram, 210 gram respectively per plant. The second dose has to apply in September-October and the dosage is 105 gram urea, 250 gram rock phosphate, 205 gram Muriate of Potash respectively per plant(Fifth year).

data.QueryText: Asked about management of pseudostem weevil in banana
data.KccAns:
Recommended to remove affected plants along with the rhizome in full and destroy them by burning the life stages of the insect using kerosene or by burying the material in deep pits in soil. Regularly remove dried hanging leaves of the plant. Observe strict field sanitation.
 Place 50 gram neem cake powder or bar soap in the leaf axils on the 5th and 7th month. 
Mix 3 ml neem oil in 1 litre mud slurry and swab around the pseudostem.
Apply neem cake in planting pits. Spray Beauveria bassiana @ 20g per litre water on pseudostem and pseudostem traps. Fill the leaf axil with Beauveria bassiana @ 20g per litre water. 
Pseudostem trap: Cut pseudo stem into small pieces in lengths of up to 60 cm and split each along its length. The split pseudo stem are placed in the soil in the way that the cut portion faces the ground. The recommended number is 30 to 40 numbers (split traps) per acre.
In case of severe attack, spray  Chlorpyrifos 25 EC (1.5 ml/litre of water) with nozzle directed to the leaf axils and bore holes.

data.QueryText: Asked about management of dieback disease of nutmeg
data.KccAns: Recommended to prun twigs 2-3 inches below the affected portion. Paste the pruned twigs with Copper oxychloride 50 WP @ 10 gram/litre of water followed by spraying of Copper oxychloride 50 WP @ 3 gram/litre of water on infected tree.

Open the coconut basin and apply Lime @ 1 kg has to be applied in acid soils two weeks before of fertilizer application.The first split has to be applied in April-June. The dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj  phos, 1  kg Potash per palm respectively. data.QueryText: Asked about management of Bud Rot in Coconut
data.KccAns: Recommended to clean the crown in general during pre-monsoon period. Cut and remove the affected parts of the crown along with healthy tissues. Poure Mancozeb solution (5 gram /300 ml of water) coupled with placing of small perforated sachets (2 no) containing 3-4 gram Mancozeb 75 WP in the inner most leaf axils. Spray Bordeaux mixture (1%) on the crown of the neighbouring palms as a prophylatic measure.

data.QueryText: Asked about agricultural land verification in AIMS portal
data.KccAns:
Recommended to do land verification through AIMS (https://www.aims.kerala.gov.in/) portal from Akshaya center or CSC. Details needed: Aadhar number, account number, phone number and tax receipt. After verification, submit details in Krishi bhavan
For more details visit https://keralaagriculture.gov.in/pmkisan-2/
User manual-
https://keralaagriculture.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/PMKISAN-LV.pdf

data.QueryText: Asked about planting of tissue culture banana
data.KccAns: Suggested to Prepare pits 15 days in advance of planting. Pit size IS 50 cm x 50 cm x 50 cm. spacing 2 m x 2 m   Fill the pits with topsoil and FYM 15-20 kg per plant per pit. Plant the tissue culture plants on the top of the page at the ground level. Remove the polythene cover completely before finding without damaging the roots. Planting may be done preferably during evening hours. Provide partial shade to plants to protect against sun scorching for about two weeks. Irrigate the crop daily during initial days of establishment.

data.QueryText: Asked about nutrient management in coconut
data.KccAns:
Recommended to apply organic manure @ 25 kg/plant  every year. Lime @ 1kg per palm has to be applied in acid soils two weeks before of fertilizer application.
The first split has to be applied in April-June. The dosage is 500 gram Urea, 750 gram Raj phos, 1000 gram Potash. .
The second dose has to apply in September-October and the dosage is 500 gram urea, 750 gram raj phos, 1000 gram Potash.
